comments.commentBody: Sometimes you get the best free advice too. I remember a homeless lady in DC telling me not to sit on the stone curb at the memorials, because that causes hemorrhoids, "which are like the wolf in your butt".
Editorial Board - please send me $5.00

Hi, Deb,
I agree with the basic decision about discontinuing the separate page for A Little Variety, but hope that the Powers will agree that solvers would appreciate (see notes already posted here):
--continuing to post a link (on the Variety post page) to the Spelling Bee answer list;
--continuing to post the Spelling Bee letters as you have been (required letter, plus alphabetical list of other letters);
and
--adding the points breakdown for the Spelling Bee, which I and others have been adding weekly.

In the olden days, we always felt bad about OT posts regarding Variety puzzles on the Sunday puzzle page - so continuing to have a home on the Variety page will be nice. But it has been a small club.

Thanks for your curatorial work!

I think the public would be better served with a running 'assessment of threat'.

What is the potential for our 'intelligence community' to run black bag jobs on those who are perceived to be a direct threat to them?

Treat investigative journalism as if our intelligence apparatus considered the press a threat instead of an ally. Instead of leaking to you, . . . journalists die. Opposition politicians are murdered like in Russia, N. Korea, and a host of third-world countries.

Since you have the confidence of the 'intelligence community', or to Normal America they are compromised and obviously rogue, just what are they capable of?

If we no longer respect them, should we fear them? Precisely, at what point do they become a clear and present danger to society?

For that is the logical conclusion should the 'intelligence community', acting on behalf of the Democrats and a compliant press, are successful in overturning the results of the last election.

What other conclusion can there be?

This is quite possibly the most disgustingly sexist and inappropriate comment I have ever read in the NYT. The (so far) 978 of you who recommended it should be ashamed of yourselves, as should the writer.

Oh, what?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LgagC4pUmQo

Hee hee

China will never do the US bidding on N. Korea. It might however deal, if it gets something from the deal, and if it is left in control of how it handles N. Korea.

China could hardly do worse with Kim than we have.

China has limits it has made clear. It wants the US kept far from China's Yalu border. It wants a soft collapse without mass refugee flows. We can offer those things.

Our friends in South Korea would approve. They see the North as their cousins, as family, and they literally are. They don't want a hard collapse either. They also would be quite pleased to reduce the dangers and costs of defense that burden them.

This could be done. It has not even been properly explored.
If Walker feels the need to steel the spines of his fellow Republicans, a few must be looking a little wobbly. I'll take this as a good sign.

Trump's people talk to the Russians it's evil. Pelosi  and Sumer talk to the Russians it's for the good of the nation. All this talking must life at the State Department difficult you know politicians interfere with policy they created. What  about the emails? See what happens when congress makes laws disregarding separation of power? Those laws tend to be ignored. No one likes their hand tied when they have to get the job done. This latest smoke blowing exercise  could have been avoided if the big brains contacted their photo department and search the archive for Russian Ambassador/American  Senator. Both sides do it but when Trump does it.

Much of the suspicion is compounded exponentially by Trumps lies regarding his taxes. He promised to release them and has now refused.  His son has said that money is "pouring in" from Russia and yet Trump denies this.  There may be evidence of quid pro quo in this taxes and they must be released.  Otherwise his name won't be cleared.
Strange that he's been overlooked by the White House.  Quick!  Get him a D.C. Job, so WI residents can breathe easy again.

I think what Mr. Walker means, really, is that he is against the influence of Washington on the way people think and make decisions. He does not want the federal government to tell the states about clean air and water, about environmental protection, about health and safety standards, or regulate financial services or commerce, or much of anything else - so that local robber barons are left on their own to do as they wish. Even law enforcement can be local, so each state can allow their friends and families to do as they wish. All schools can then be privatized, and all students can be required to read only one book (er., let the parents decide). This is what 'state' control really means.

But I think he will want to keep the federal spigot on to feed every red state in the union for its defense, agriculture, and other jobs programs. Kind of like cake and eating too.
I think Pussy Riot might have played at a benefit for HRC once.

I find it interesting that you totally discount the wishes of the 100,000 "taxpayers" who protested.  Then you discount the wishes of the majority of the voters in the last election.  They did not vote for Trump.  The only elective advantage that the Republicans have over the Democrats at this point in time is from gerrymandering.  If the majority of the people of the United States had their way, the Republicans would never been in the majority again.  Up until now, Democrats believed that democracy was more important than winning.  The Republicans gave up on democracy a long time ago and therefore started a strategy of gerrymandering to take a way the power of the majority to rule.  But demographics are against you.  Trump may very well be the last gasp of the Republican Party.  And my goodness, what a way to go.

Yep, give Mississippi (or other states) the money and watch it disappear.....when will republicans accept that States are and have been dependent on the federal authority...........the only thing left are quaint notions of federalism.   Scott Walker has no idea what he is talking about.....and bad hair....sad.

The "skirting  ethical lines" sentence is nonsense. If you are breaking the law you are past ethical lines. If instead you are not committing the crime when they are trying to catch you, that's not an ethical line, it is just avoiding being caught.

Governor Walker admits that Republican orthodoxy focuses on destroying federalism.  The central idea, you know, of the United States.  The country that Congress folk swear to defend, honor, etc.  I always feel there are a lot of folks who are still angry about the outcome of the Civil War.  I guess these are the people Governor Walker is talking to.  I get the sick feeling that the "liberals" whose side of the conversation Walker fears are the spiritual descendants of people who went to war to fight slavery.  Yeah, we know.  You "won".  You cheated, you lied, you sold anarchy. The truth is coming out too late is a major reason for your success.  Now you are going to do your worst to the rest of us.  Just get off that self-righteous morality.  You can get over the pity party now.  Liberals intimidating the GOP!  Is that really all you got?

Go right ahead...we are waiting.
You cannot silence those who disagree, however.

Oh and by the way, we are taking notes. Because we don't think you will be successful and your policies will be worse for americans, as they always have.

But you ARE hilariously quaint with your down-home attitude:
"Or take my battle with Washington to test people seeking public assistance for drug use. They should be employed or enrolled in job training, looking for work five times a week and able to pass a drug test. If they fail, we would get them into rehab and into the work force."

Who's gonna pay for rehab? And why spend money trying to deny people who are asking for help - it is soulless? The 'drug' problem is never funded like all things under you liars. It goes on and on and that is why we vent: the depth of your uncaring is endless.
I hope this is sarcasm!
Gov. Walker: Wait, you forgot to mention Gov. Sam Brownback (R) and the wildly successful work he's done in Kansas.

Tornado that saved Washington from the demonic war hardened British troops in the war of 1812
https://historicaldigression.com/2012/03/26/a-tornado-saves-washington-d...

Good looking whirlwinds marching in lockstep through wisconsin and kansas ectect with a goosestep serving as eye candy turning the watchers into believers nip in the bud Scot walker types who do not releasing what kind of King demons they are releasing upon our world
We are a damn sight better off from the huge chasm left by Bush eight years ago.

Isn't this the same governor who cut $350 million dollars from the University of Wisconsin so he could give it to a crony to build a new sports stadium in Milwaukee? Yeah, he "stood strong in his fight for taxpayers." Give 'em bread and circuses, or never mind, just give 'em the circuses and forget about the bread. The big bread goes to the wealthy.

And job creation? Ranks 33rd in the nation. I guess you can only build so many stadiums.

Why is the New York Times printing Walker's self-serving garbage? I don't recall you ever giving space to Hillary Clinton to allow her to discuss her plans for the nation. For that matter, during the election I don't recall the NYT doing much other than obsessing over her emails, without even wondering WHY only hers and the DNC's were hacked in the first place.

There's a story about C.S. Lewis that's on point.  Walking with a friend, he passed a panhandler; he gave the man a pound.  His friend cocked an eyebrow and said, "He'll just buy liquor with it."  As they reached their destination and Lewis opened the pub door, he replied, "Well, that's what I was going to do with it."

A plea to all our elected officials (including our billionaire President)-- none of you have ever known what financial hardship is and it is hard to imagine fully if you have not had to live it as so many have/are....

Please remember that very few humans CHOOSE poverty/disability/poor living conditions/hunger/unemployment.... as you preach from the WH for your constituents to "learn to live leaner" & "make do with less". Many of your constituents(and many others throughout the world, as the Pope correctly advises) are living so lean they're barely living and there's very little less they can do without.....

Perhaps our elected officials can live on a 'budget' such as someone in poverty or near-poverty does?

See Cory Booker's effort to live on food stamps. He may be fortunate, but he's made an attempt to walk a mile in the shoes off the least of us. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2012/12/04/166475063/living-on-fo...
